src package

Submodules

src.ingest_data module

Preparation of Datasets

This module demonstates loading of dataset from a github repository ie., https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ageron/handson-ml/master/datasets/housing/housing.tgz and preprocess the datasets for training and testing sets.

Syntax to run the file

$ python src/ingest_data.py

Notes

Please note the following librabries need to be installed before you run this module. To install the librabries, run this commmand

$ pip install -r requirements.txt

Attributes

HOUSING_URLstr

Defines the source for the dataset

HOUSING_PATHstr

Defines the folder in which datasets are extracted

class src.ingest_data.CombinedAttributesAdder(add_bedrooms_per_room=True)[source]

Bases: sklearn.base.BaseEstimator, sklearn.base.TransformerMixin

Class creates customised attributes to add to the datasets

BaseEstimator : default TransformerMixin : default

np array

To add to the preprocessed datasets

src.ingest_data.fetch_housing_data(housing_url='https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ageron/handson-ml/master/datasets/housing/housing.tgz', housing_path='datasets')[source]

src.ingest_data.split(housing, housing_path='datasets')[source]

Function to preprocess the original datasets to obtain a scaled numeric train and test dataframes

Please do read read about handling the categorical data using onehotecoder. Attention Required on the usuage of Pipelines and CustomTransformers.

housing : pd DataFrame housing_path : str

csv files

csv trainingset_file saved at the specific housing_path csv testset_file saved at the specific housing_path

src.score module

Testing and Evaluation of Datasets

This module demonstates testing the models based on testing datasets and resulted models so that it can used for predictions and evaluation of models

Syntax to run the file

$ python src/score.py “Enter the common directory to load the regression models”

Notes

Please note the following librabries need to be installed before you run this module. To install the librabries, run this commmand

$ pip install -r requirements.txt

Attributes

HOUSING_PATHstr

Defines the folder in which datasets are extracted

src.score.configure_logger(logger=None, cfg=None, log_file=None, console=True, log_level='DEBUG')[source]

Reads the configured file to save the logs

log_filefile

The first parameter.

string

The datalogs of the program to be stored in log file

src.score.eval_metrics(actual, pred)[source]

Function to evaluate based on predicted and original values.

actual : list pred : list

rmse : float mae : float r2 : float

Results in metrics evaluation of the lists

Reads the configured path ie., env.yaml file to get the testing preprocessed datasets

string

The default directory mentioned to read the datasets.

Reads the configured path ie., env.yaml file to get the data

src.score.score(housing_path, model='Lin_reg.pkl')[source]

Function to result the predicted outputs on testing datasets and evaluate the respective models

housing_path : str model : ML model

rmse : float mae : float r2 : float

Results in metrics evaluation of the saved models based on testing_datasets

src.train module

Training of Datasets

This module demonstates training the models based on training datasets and results models that can used for predictions and evaluation of models

Syntax to run the file

$ python src/train.py “Enter the common directory to save the regression models”

Notes

Please note the following librabries need to be installed before you run this module. To install the librabries, run this commmand

$ pip install -r requirements.txt

Attributes

HOUSING_PATHstr

Defines the folder in which datasets are extracted
